page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY-BUMBLES GREEN
page.content: A middle-aged resident recalled that the annual fair,held in the grounds of Nazeing Park school,enticed his grand-father to cycle from Ongar,Essex whilst in more contemporary times other large houses in the area have housed famous names from the stage and the football field. Rivilanes dating from the dissension caused by the civil war were blamed for the social coolness between the two parts of the village.The traditional "beating of the bands" is still carried on whilst other village entertainments include flower shows and animal events at Harolds Park farm. Bumbles Green was thought to be an ideal place to live,just far enough away from Harlow New town although one man blamed Harlow for "speeding up our lives"
